title: Chocolate Orange Marble Cake
description: This moist and visually stunning Chocolate Orange Marble Cake perfectly balances rich chocolate with bright citrus flavors. Its tender crumb and elegant marbled design make it a delightful treat for any occasion, from casual afternoon tea to special celebrations.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour one 10 inch tube pan.
In a large bowl, cream the butter with 1 cup of the white sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then add the vanilla extract and plain yogurt, mixing well.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
Gradually beat the dry ingredients into the creamed mixture until just combined.
Divide the batter evenly into two bowls.
Stir the grated orange zest into one bowl of batter.
Add the melted unsweetened chocolate to the other bowl of batter and mix well.
Alternately spoon the orange and chocolate batters into the prepared tube pan.
Use a knife to gently swirl through the batters to create a marbled effect.
Bake in the preheated oven for 50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
While the cake is baking, combine the remaining 1/4 cup sugar, orange juice, and orange liqueur in a small bowl.
As soon as the cake is removed from the oven, pour the orange glaze evenly over the hot cake.
Allow the cake to cool completely on a wire rack before removing from the pan and serving.
tips: For a more intense orange flavor, add extra zest or substitute some yogurt with vanilla yogurt. Avoid overmixing the batter to keep the cake tender. When swirling the batters, use gentle motions to maintain distinct marbling without blending the colors too much. Let the cake cool fully before slicing to preserve its moist texture.

structured_content.content: Experience the delightful harmony of rich chocolate and vibrant orange in this beautifully marbled cake. Its moist texture and aromatic citrus notes make it a standout dessert that captivates both the eyes and palate.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 1 hour
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for celebrations, afternoon tea, or weekend baking
  • Uses simple, pantry-friendly ingredients
  • Striking marbled appearance that impresses guests

structured_content.content: This recipe holds a special place in my kitchen as a go-to for gifting and gatherings. The first time I made it, the aroma of orange and chocolate swirling through the house instantly lifted everyone’s spirits.

• Main ingredient: Use unsweetened chocolate squares for a deep, authentic chocolate flavor that balances the bright orange zest perfectly.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Freshly grated orange zest and orange liqueur provide vibrant citrus notes; choose ripe, fragrant oranges for best results.
  • Supporting ingredients: Plain yogurt adds moisture and tenderness, while baking soda and powder ensure a light, fluffy crumb.
  • Equipment needed: A 10-inch tube pan for even baking and a sharp knife for swirling the batter to create the marbled effect.

Preparation:
Cream butter and sugar until fluffy, then incorporate eggs, vanilla, and yogurt. Sift dry ingredients separately and fold gently into wet mixture to avoid overmixing.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Divide batter, flavor each portion, and layer alternately in the pan. Swirl gently with a knife to create a beautiful marble pattern. Bake at 350°F for 50 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.
Finishing Touches:
Pour the orange liqueur glaze over the hot cake immediately after baking to infuse extra moisture and flavor. Cool completely before serving for best texture.

upload.context: Beautiful finished dish with vibrant colors and appetizing presentation

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Maintain oven temperature at 350°F for even baking and moist crumb
  • Avoid overbaking to prevent dryness—check doneness with a toothpick
  • The glaze should be poured while the cake is hot to soak in properly
  • Store leftovers wrapped tightly at room temperature for up to 3 days or refrigerate for longer freshness

structured_content.content: Sharing this cake with family has created many joyful memories, especially during holidays when its bright orange aroma fills the home, sparking smiles and warm conversations.

Enhance the cake by adding a pinch of cinnamon or nutmeg to the batter for a subtle spice twist. Swap orange liqueur for Grand Marnier or triple sec for varied citrus notes. For extra richness, drizzle melted dark chocolate over the cooled cake before serving.

Serve slices with a dollop of whipped cream or vanilla ice cream for a decadent treat. Pair with a cup of freshly brewed coffee or Earl Grey tea to complement the citrus and chocolate flavors. Ideal for brunch, dessert tables, or festive gatherings.

For a gluten-free version, substitute all-purpose flour with a gluten-free baking blend. Vegan adaptations can use plant-based butter and yogurt alternatives, and replace eggs with flaxseed or chia egg substitutes. Experiment by replacing orange zest with lemon or lime for a different citrus profile.

upload.context: Close-up detail showing texture, layers, or key visual elements that make the dish appealing

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Cream butter and sugar thoroughly to incorporate air for a light cake
  • Use room temperature eggs to help batter emulsify smoothly
  • Swirl batters gently to keep distinct marbling without mixing colors
  • Glaze the cake while hot to lock in moisture and enhance flavor

structured_content.content: With this recipe, you can confidently create a stunning cake that delights both the eyes and taste buds. Enjoy the process and the delicious results that will surely impress your friends and family.
